text: Eugenio Szabados (far right) in Amsterdam, 1950 Eugenio Szabados (3 July 1898, Sangar?,Gaige. Hungary 6 March 1974, Venice) was a Hungarian–Italian chess master. In 1921, he won in Società Scacchistica Torinese Championship. In 1921, he tied for 5-7th in Viareggio. In 1923, he took 3rd, behind Ferrari and Formanek, in Triest (torneo principale). In 1928, he took 5th in Venice. In 1929, he took 8th in Venice. In 1930, he took 2nd, behind Jacques Mieses, in Venice.La grande storia degli scacchi In 1948, he tied for 9-11th in Venice (Miguel Najdorf won). In 1949, he took 13th in Venice (László Szabó won). In 1950, he tied for 18-20th in Amsterdam (Najdorf won). In 1950, he tied for 15-16th in Venice (Alexander Kotov won). In 1951, he took 2nd in Venice (14th ITA-ch). In 1952, he tied for 7-8th in Ferrara (15th ITA-ch). In 1953, he took 6th in Florence (16th ITA-ch). In 1953, he took 12th in Venice (Esteban Canal won). He played for Italy in friendly matches; ITA–SUI at Venice 1951, ITA–SUI at Lausanne 1952, ITA–YUG at Bled 1953.OlimpBase :: the encyclopaedia of team chess In 1950–1958 he was a President of FSI. Awarded the IM title in 1951. == References == Category:1898 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Hungarian chess players Category:Italian chess players Category:Chess International Masters Category:Italian people of Hungarian descent Category:20th-century chess players
title: Eugenio Szabados
